title: Get Lectured: University of Pennsylvania, Spring '25
author: Josh Niland
byline: By Josh Niland Jan 12, '25 7:59 AM EST
excerpt: The University of Pennsylvania Stuart Weitzman School of Design has shared its packed slate of Spring 2025 lecture speakers as part of our Get Lectured roundup for the new academic term. text: The University of Pennsylvania Stuart Weitzman School of Design has shared its packed slate of Spring 2025 lecture speakers as part of our Get Lectured roundup for the new academic term. Following the presentation of the Kanter Tritsch Medal in Architecture to SANAA co-founders Kazuyo Sejima and Ryue Nishizawa on January 22, the month of January’s lecturers include Dorothy Krotzer (January 23); STOSS founding director Chris Reed and photographer Mike Belleme (January 23); and Bjarke Ingels (January 29). February’s headliners include Michael Lens (February 4); Boonserm Premthada’s EwingCole Lecture (February 5); The Anne Whiston Spirn Lecture on Snøhetta’s landscape designs from Michelle Delk (February 6); artist Leslie Thornton (January 6); Harvard Demonstration Forest Senior Ecologist and Research Director Jonathan Thompson (February 11); Lara Davis (February 13); Bob Inglis (February 13); Garnette Cadogan (February 13); Pier LaFarge (February 14); Clio Andris (February 18); and Jeffrey Nesbit (February 27). March begins with Niall Mac Dowel’s talk 'Getting Real About Net-Zero' on March 4. The month continues with lectures from Kwesi Daniels and Kecia Fond (March 6); BlackMass (March 6); author Andrew Lee (March 18); The Turner Construction Lecture from Fabrizio Barozzi (March 19); David Malda of GGN (March 20); and the Brummer Lecture featuring Billie Tsien March 26. The final month of the semester includes The KPF Lecture from Junya Ishigami (April 2); Diane Severin Nguyen (April 10); Susan Schuppli and Robert Gerard Pietrusko April 10 & 11); Michelle Franco (April 17); and the McHarg Fellow Lecture from Leah Kahler on April 24.
